author: South Florida Sun-Sentinel
title: A look at Coral Springs, from the 1960s to today - Sun Sentinel
text:
A look at Coral Springs, from the 1960s to today Coral Springs history Courtesy of Coral Springs City Hall 
Resident Gordon Ickes in 1963. The rifle was for poisonous snakes, wildcats and stray cattle. 
Resident Gordon Ickes in 1963. The rifle was for poisonous snakes, wildcats and stray cattle. (Courtesy of Coral Springs City Hall) Courtesy of Coral Springs City Hall 
In 1947, Coral Ridge Properties was founded. 
In 1947, Coral Ridge Properties was founded. (Courtesy of Coral Springs City Hall) See more galleries 
Coral Ridge Properties developed land in Fort Lauderdale and when it ran out of land, it looked west. It built the city of Coral Springs from scratch starting in 1963. Westinghouse acquired the company in 1966 and built "Electra Lab" houses with conveniences such as motion detectors and intercoms. Today the city is still known for its family-oriented neighborhoods and sought-after schools. By Lisa J. Huriash
